keyword: how many calories in sliced tomatoes
title: How Many Calories in Sliced Tomatoes?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in sliced tomatoes per 100 g, with full nutrition facts including carbs, protein, fiber, and healthy tweaks for salads.
h1: How Many Calories in Sliced Tomatoes?
assumptions: Fresh, ripe red tomatoes, thinly sliced, no added salt, oil, or dressing.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by tomato variety, ripeness, size, and preparation; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of sliced tomatoes provides about 18 kcal and is rich in vitamins with minimal fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp olive oil dressing per 100 g
Sprinkle with 1 tsp grated parmesan per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g sliced tomatoes?
faqs.a: About 18 kcal per 100 g of fresh sliced tomatoes.
Yes, only 3.9 g carbs per 100 g, with 1.2 g fiber.

faqs.q: What nutrients are in sliced tomatoes besides calories?
faqs.a: High in vitamin C and potassium; 0.9 g protein, 0.2 g fat, and 2.6 g natural sugars.
Very low at 5 mg per 100 g naturally; adding salt increases it.

faqs.q: How does slicing affect tomato calories?
faqs.a: Slicing doesn't change calories; it's the same as whole fresh tomatoes.
